An hour before Mr Andy Coulson 's announcement, during a visit to RAF Brize Norton in Mr David Cameron 's Oxfordshire constituency, the Prime Minister was asked if he still had faith in him. He said: You know what I have said about this in the past. I have got nothing to add to that and I think he's done a very good job for the Government. 1155 David Cameron has expressed his sorry at the resignation and said that Mr Andy Coulson carried his duties with the "complete professionalism". He said that he expects Mr Andy Coulson to continue to have a successful career

we must be, because the loss of Andy Coulson 's link to ordinariness is considered to disadvantage Cameron, not just electorally, but in the sense that he will be a less complete and sympathetic politician without it. No politician can govern well, we believe, who does not understand what it is to be ordinary. But what about when an actual example of ordinariness shows his head, tells us what he thinks, allows us a glimpse, inadvertent or otherwise, into his unexamined biases and assumptions? Andy Coulson confirmed his resignation in a statement on Friday, saying that the continued coverage of events during his time as the editor of "News of the World' had made it difficult for him to give the 110 per cent needed in this role." Solid growth in our core business and very strong growth in our emerging businesses drove 24% revenue growth year over year. We saw strength in every major product area, as more and more traditional brand advertisers embraced search advertising and as large advertisers increasingly ran integrated campaigns across search, display, and mobile. We feel confident about our future, and plan to continue to invest aggressively in our core areas of strategic focus. Q2 Financial Summary Google Inc. reported revenues of$ 6.82 billion for the quarter ended June 30, 2010, an increase of 24% compared to the second quarter of 2009.
